rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you. See [[WP:FIXNF]] and [[WP:10CR]]
rev.diff:
Line 138: Line 138:
====British Mandate period====
====British Mandate period====
â
[[Image:Rabanposter.jpg|thumb|right|Poster for the Society for the Promotion of Travel in the Holy Land. 1929 Lithograph]]
 
* 1918: [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom]]: ''Minutes'': "[[Edward Turnour, 6th Earl Winterton|Major Earl Winterton]] asked the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs what facilities have been given to the Palestinian and Syrian political leaders now in Egypt to visit Palestine?"<ref>[http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/written_answers/1918/jun/25/arab-political-representatives-visit-to#S5CV0107P0_19180625_CWA_29 Hansard ARAB POLITICAL REPRESENTATIVES (VISIT TO PALESTINE). HC Deb 25 June 1918 vol 107 c903W]</ref> An early use of the word Palestinian in British politics, which was used often in following years in the British government<ref>[http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/search/palestinians?sort=date Hansard search "Palestinian"]</ref>
* 1918: [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom]]: ''Minutes'': "[[Edward Turnour, 6th Earl Winterton|Major Earl Winterton]] asked the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs what facilities have been given to the Palestinian and Syrian political leaders now in Egypt to visit Palestine?"<ref>[http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/written_answers/1918/jun/25/arab-political-representatives-visit-to#S5CV0107P0_19180625_CWA_29 Hansard ARAB POLITICAL REPRESENTATIVES (VISIT TO PALESTINE). HC Deb 25 June 1918 vol 107 c903W]</ref> An early use of the word Palestinian in British politics, which was used often in following years in the British government<ref>[http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/search/palestinians?sort=date Hansard search "Palestinian"]</ref>
* 1919: [[Zionist Organization]], ''Statement on Palestine at the [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]]'': "The boundaries of Palestine shall follow the general lines set out below: Starting on the North at a point on the Mediterranean Sea in the vicinity south of [[Sidon]] and following the watersheds of the foothills of the Lebanon as far as [[Jisr El-Karaon]] thence to [[El-Bire]], following the dividing line between the two basins of the [[Wadi El-Korn]] and the [[Wadi Et-Teim]], thence in a southerly direction following the dividing line between the Eastern and Western slopes of the [[Mount Hermon|Hermon]], to the vicinity west of [[Beit Jenn]], then eastward following the northern watersheds of the [[Nahr Mughaniye]] close to and west of the [[Hedjaz Railway]]. In the east a line close to and west of the Hedjaz Railway terminating in the [[Gulf of Akaba]]. In the south a frontier to be agreed upon with the Egyptian Government. In the west the Mediterranean Sea."<ref>[http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/zoparis.html Zionist Organization Statement on Palestine, Paris Peace Conference, February 3, 1919]</ref><ref>[http://www.mideastweb.org/zionistborders.htm Paris Peace Conference Zionist Organisation - proposed map of Paletine]</ref>
* 1919: [[Zionist Organization]], ''Statement on Palestine at the [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]]'': "The boundaries of Palestine shall follow the general lines set out below: Starting on the North at a point on the Mediterranean Sea in the vicinity south of [[Sidon]] and following the watersheds of the foothills of the Lebanon as far as [[Jisr El-Karaon]] thence to [[El-Bire]], following the dividing line between the two basins of the [[Wadi El-Korn]] and the [[Wadi Et-Teim]], thence in a southerly direction following the dividing line between the Eastern and Western slopes of the [[Mount Hermon|Hermon]], to the vicinity west of [[Beit Jenn]], then eastward following the northern watersheds of the [[Nahr Mughaniye]] close to and west of the [[Hedjaz Railway]]. In the east a line close to and west of the Hedjaz Railway terminating in the [[Gulf of Akaba]]. In the south a frontier to be agreed upon with the Egyptian Government. In the west the Mediterranean Sea."<ref>[http://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/History/zoparis.html Zionist Organization Statement on Palestine, Paris Peace Conference, February 3, 1919]</ref><ref>[http://www.mideastweb.org/zionistborders.htm Paris Peace Conference Zionist Organisation - proposed map of Paletine]</ref>
